keyword: how many calories are in a meatball
title: How Many Calories Are in a Meatball?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a meatball, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, carbs, and variations for different preparations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Meatball?
assumptions: Standard beef meatball (~28 g or 1 oz), baked or pan-fried, no sauce or breadcrumbs added.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by meat type, size, recipe, cooking method, and brand. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One standard meatball contains about 60 kcal and 5 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp marinara sauce per meatball
Use turkey instead of beef per meatball
Fried in oil (vs. baked) per meatball

faqs.q: How many calories are in a meatball?
faqs.a: About 60 kcal for one standard beef meatball.

faqs.q: What is the protein in a single meatball?

faqs.a: Yes, about 2 g carbs per meatball, mainly from binders like breadcrumbs.

faqs.q: How does meatball size affect calories?
faqs.a: Larger meatballs (e.g., 50 g) can have 100+ kcal; smaller ones less.

faqs.q: Are homemade meatballs lower in calories?
faqs.a: Often yes, if baked and lean meat is used, but added ingredients vary totals.
